PIONEER DIET: WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN PIONEERS EAT?

Instructions: Please answer as many of these questions as you can and mail it to us.

Saskatchewan Archives Office, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, SASK., where it will be preserved as part of the permanent record of our province.

Name: W.F. HARGARTEN

Address: BRINQ... SASK.

Birthplace: GERMANY

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? APRIL 16, 1906.

Where did you set up housekeeping? ON THE FARM.

How long have you lived there? SINCE 1906.

For how many people did you prepare meals? 4.

How far was it to your nearest store? 15 MILES TO BATTLEFORD.

How often could a visit be made to the store? EVERY 2 WEEKS.

What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years? OATMEAL & FLOUR.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? X. FLOUR.

In what quantities did you buy it? 50 LBS.

What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? 18¢.

How much did you use graham flour? 50 LBS.

Was flour milled locally? NO.

What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? 3¢.

What other grain products did you use? CORNMEAL.

Other? RICE.

Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? NO.

How did you grind it? WITH A MILL.
